title: FIFA Women's World Cup Twitter page incorrectly claim highlights are of Lucy Bronze
text:
An official World Cup Twitter page was left with egg on their face after they uploaded highlights of Lucy Bronze... only for the England star to point out that they 'got the wrong player'.

The FIFA Women's World Cup page put up a string of highlights celebrating Bronze's brilliant display at this summer's tournament, where the right-back received praise for her performances from FIFA’s Technical Study Group.

The official account tweeted: 'We take a look at some of the #FIFAWWC highlights of @Lionesses star and #TheBest nominee @LucyBronze with her work praised by FIFA’s Technical Study Group at France 2019.'

Lucy Bronze has pointed out a big blunder made by an official FIFA Twitter account on Sunday

Bronze let the FIFA Women's World Cup page that they 'got the wrong player' in their highlights

However, shortly after appearing on their Twitter feed, Bronze called out the post by making them aware of their gaffe.

The 27-year-old responded: 'Thanks. But these highlights aren’t me... you got the wrong player.'

The post stayed online for several more hours before being taken down.

Fans flocked to Bronze's post to poke fun at the situation.

Fans flocked to the post, which has now been taken down, to laugh at the awkward exchange

'That explains why you didn't win. They've all been watching the wrong player!!' one fan joked.

Another Twitter user simply described the exchange as 'awkward' while another claimed the official Women's World Cup page had 'one job to do'.

Bronze was named in FIFA's Women's World XI alongside Megan Rapinoe and Alex Morgan at TheBest awards ceremony last Monday.

Bronze, who plays for Lyon, helped England reach fourth in the World Cup after losing to Sweden in the third-place play-off.
description: An official World Cup Twitter page was left with egg on their face after they uploaded highlights of Lucy Bronze... only for the England star to point out that they 'got the wrong player'.
